translation: Good man, at that time I also thought: Though I am ignorant now, this rākṣasa might be able to see the buddhas of the past.

source_sentence: 從諸佛所聞是半偈，我今當問。』
translation: What I've heard from the buddhas is half a verse, and now I'll ask questions.'

source_sentence: 即便前至是羅剎所，作如是言：『善哉，大士！
translation: He went up to the Rāṣṭrapāla and said, 'Splendid, great man!'

source_sentence: 汝於何處得是過去離怖畏者所說半偈？
translation: Where did you get this half a verse spoken by someone who was free of fear in the past?

source_sentence: 大士！
translation: Great man!

source_sentence: 復於何處而得如是半如意珠？
translation: Where else could he obtain such a half- wish-granting pearl?

source_sentence: 大士！
translation: Great man!

source_sentence: 是半偈義，乃是過去、未來、現在諸佛世尊之正道也。
translation: The meaning of this half-verse is that it's the right path of the world-honored buddhas of the past, future, and present.

source_sentence: 一切世間無量眾生，常為諸見羅網所覆，終身於此外道法中，初不曾聞，
translation: Countless sentient beings in all the worlds are always shrouded by webs of views, and for the rest of their lives they have never heard any teaching from anyone else.

source_sentence: 如是出世十力、世雄所說空義。』
translation: Thus are these supramundane ten powers and the meaning of emptiness taught by worldly heroes.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我問是已，即答我言：『大婆羅門！
translation: After I asked this, he answered me, 'Great brāhmaṇa!

source_sentence: 汝今不應問我是義。
translation: Now, you shouldn't ask about the meaning of self.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 我不食來已經多日，處處求索，了不能得。
translation: I haven't eaten for many days, and everywhere I've begged for it, but I can't get it.

source_sentence: 飢渴苦惱，心亂讇語，非我本心之所知也。
translation: Hungry and thirsty, painful and distressed, their minds are disturbed by harsh speech, which isn't known in my original mind.

source_sentence: 假使我今力能飛行虛空至欝單越，乃至天上，處處求食亦不能得，以是之故，
translation: Suppose I were to be able to fly through space and reach Uttarakuru or even up to the heavens, but could not obtain food wherever I wished. Because of this,

source_sentence: 我說是語。』
translation: I'll say this.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我時即復語羅剎言：『大士！
translation: I then again said to Rāṣṭrapāla, 'Great man!

source_sentence: 若能為我說是偈竟，我當終身為汝弟子。
translation: If you can finish this verse for me, I'll be your disciple for the rest of my life.

source_sentence: 大士！
translation: Great man!

source_sentence: 汝所說者，名字不終，義亦不盡。
translation: What you say has names that don't end and meanings that don't end.

source_sentence: 以何因緣不欲說耶？
translation: Why don't you want to explain it?

source_sentence: 夫財施者則有竭盡，法施因緣不可盡也。
translation: The gift of material goods is inexhaustible, and the causes and conditions for giving the Dharma are inexhaustible.

source_sentence: 雖無有盡，多所利益。
translation: Although it is inexhaustible, it has many benefits.

source_sentence: 我今聞此半偈法已，心生驚疑，汝今幸可為我除斷，說此偈竟，我當終身為汝弟子。』
translation: Now that I've heard this half-verse teaching, my mind becomes frightened and doubtful, so please remove it for me. After you finish speaking this verse, I will be your disciple for the rest of my life.'

source_sentence: 羅剎答言：『汝智太過，但自憂身，都不見念，今我定為飢苦所逼，實不能說。』
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla replied, 'Your knowledge is too great, but you only grieve for your own body and don't see it. Now that I'm certainly being driven by hunger and suffering, I really can't explain it.'

source_sentence: 我即問言：『汝所食者，為是何物？』
translation: I then asked, 'What's the thing you eat?'

source_sentence: 羅剎答言：『汝不足問，我若說者，令多人怖。』
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla replied, 'It's not enough for you to ask questions; if I say so, it will cause many people to be afraid.'

source_sentence: 我復問言：『此中獨處，更無有人，我不畏汝，何故不說？』
translation: Again, I asked, 'There's no one here alone, and I don't fear you; why isn't it explained?'

source_sentence: 羅剎答言：『我所食者，唯人暖肉。
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla replied, 'All I eat is human flesh that's warm.

source_sentence: 其所飲者，唯人熱血。
translation: The only thing they drink is human feverish blood.

source_sentence: 自我薄福，唯食此食，周遍求索困不能得。
translation: Because their own merits are weak, they only eat this food and search everywhere for it but can't get it.

source_sentence: 世雖多人，皆有福德，兼為諸天之所守護，而我無力不能得殺。』
translation: Although there are many people in the world, they all have merit and are guarded by gods, but I can't kill them because of my power.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我復語言：『汝但具足，說是半偈，我聞偈已，當以此身奉施供養。
translation: I then said, 'You are only fully endowed with these half-verse verses; after hearing them, I will offer this body as an offering.'

source_sentence: 大士！
translation: Great man!

source_sentence: 我設命終，如此之身無所復用，當為虎狼、鵄梟、鵰鷲之所噉食，然復不得一毫之福。
translation: If my life were to end, such a body wouldn't be used again, and I would be eaten by tigers, wolves, hawks, owls, and eagles, but I wouldn't attain even a tiny bit of merit.

source_sentence: 我今為求阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，捨不堅身，以易堅身。』
translation: Now, for the sake of seeking unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, I'll abandon my body that's not firm and exchange it for a firm body.'

source_sentence: 羅剎答言：『誰當信汝如是之言，為八字故，棄所愛身？』
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla replied, 'Who will believe such words of yours and abandon the body that you love because it's eight words?'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我即答言：『汝真無智，譬如有人，施他凡器，得七寶器。
translation: I replied, 'Thus, you really have no knowledge.' It's like a person who gives an ordinary vessel to someone else and gets a seven-jeweled vessel.

source_sentence: 我亦如是，捨不堅身，得金剛身。
translation: In the same way, I abandoned my insubstantial body and attained the adamantine body.

source_sentence: 汝言誰當信者？
translation: You say, Who will believe it?

source_sentence: 我今有證，大梵天王、釋提桓因及四天王，能證是事。
translation: World-Honored One, I now have proof. Great Brahmā, the lord of the gods Śakra Devānām-Indra and the four deva kings are able to prove this.

source_sentence: 復有天眼諸菩薩等，為欲利益無量眾生，修行大乘具六度者，亦能證知。
translation: Also, there are divine-eyed bodhisattvas and others who want to benefit measureless sentient beings and cultivate the great vehicle with the six perfections in order to cultivate them, and they can also realize them.

source_sentence: 復有十方諸佛世尊利眾生者，亦能證我，為八字故，捨於身命。』
translation: Again, there are buddhas and world-honored ones in the ten directions who benefit sentient beings and can also realize self, abandoning body and life for the sake of the eight words.'

source_sentence: 羅剎復言：『汝若如是能捨身者，諦聽諦聽，當為汝說，其餘半偈。』
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla then said, 'If you can thus abandon your body, listen closely and attentively, and I will explain the other half a verse for you.'

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於爾時聞是事已，心中歡喜，即解己身所著鹿皮，為此羅剎敷置法座，
translation: Having heard these words, I was overjoyed. Then I relieved myself of the sandalwood skin on which I was wearing and spread out the seat of the Dharma for the sake of this rākṣasa.

source_sentence: 白言：『和上！
translation: He said, 'Sir, Upāsaka!

source_sentence: 願坐此座。』
translation: May I sit here at this seat?'

source_sentence: 我即於前，叉手長跪，而作是言：『唯願和上！
translation: I knelt with palms joined and said:

source_sentence: 善為我說，其餘半偈，令得具足。』
translation: Well explain it for me, and the other half a verse will be complete.'

source_sentence: 「『生滅滅已，　　寂滅為樂。』
translation: 'After arising ceases and ceases, cessation becomes bliss.'

source_sentence: 羅剎即說：「爾時羅剎說是偈已復作是言：『菩薩摩訶薩，汝今已聞具足偈義，
translation: The rākṣasa then said: Having uttered this verse, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva spoke these verses:

source_sentence: 汝之所願為悉滿足，若必欲利諸眾生者，時施我身。』
translation: Your wishes will be fulfilled, and if you must want to benefit sentient beings, then give me your body.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我於爾時深思此義，然後處處，若石、若壁、若樹、若道，書寫此偈，
translation: At that time I thought deeply about the meaning of this teaching and wrote these verses everywhere, on rocks, walls, trees, paths, and roads.

source_sentence: 即便更繫所著衣裳，恐其死後身體露現，即上高樹。
translation: Fearing that his body would be exposed after death, he climbed up a high tree.

source_sentence: 爾時樹神復問我言：『善哉，仁者！
translation: It was then that the tree spirit again asked me, 'Good, my lord!'

source_sentence: 欲作何事？』
translation: What do you want to do?'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我時答言：『我欲捨身，以報偈價。』
translation: I then answered, 'I want to abandon my body in order to repay the price of the verse.'

source_sentence: 樹神問言：『如是偈者，何所利益？』
translation: The tree god asked, 'What's the benefit of such a verse?'

source_sentence: 我時答言：『如是偈句，乃是過去、未來、現在諸佛所說開空法道，我為此法，
translation: I replied, “Such is the doctrine of emptiness taught by the buddhas of the past, future, and present.

source_sentence: 棄捨身命。
translation: He abandons his body and life.

source_sentence: 不為利養、名聞、財寶、轉輪聖王、四大天王、釋提桓因、大梵天王、人天中樂，
translation: They do not seek profit, fame or fame, wealth or possessions, the thrones of the universal monarchs, the four great deva kings, the lords of the gods, Indra, Brahmā, or the pleasures of humans and goddesses.

source_sentence: 為欲利益一切眾生，故捨此身。』
translation: I want to benefit all sentient beings, so I abandon this body.'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我捨身時，復作是言：『願令一切慳惜之人，悉來見我，捨離此身。
translation: When I gave up my body, I again said, 'May all stingy people come to see me and abandon this body.'

source_sentence: 若有少施起貢高者，亦令得見，我為一偈捨此身命，如棄草木。』
translation: If there's a little generosity that gives rise to pride and makes them see it, I'll abandon this body and life for a verse like discarding grass and trees.'

source_sentence: 我於爾時說是語已，尋即放身自投樹下，下未至地時，虛空之中出種種聲，
translation: Having uttered these words, I immediately released my body and fled to the foot of a tree. When I came down but did not reach the ground, various sounds emerged from space.

source_sentence: 其聲乃至阿迦尼吒。
translation: Its sound reaches up to the point where it's called Akaniṣṭha.

source_sentence: 爾時羅剎還復釋身，即於空中接取我身，安置平地。
translation: It was then that the rāṣāṇa again released his body, picked me up in the air, and placed me on a level ground.

source_sentence: 「爾時釋提桓因及諸天人、大梵天王，稽首頂禮於我足下，讚言：『善哉，
translation: At that time Śakra Devānām-Indra, the lord of the gods, as well as all the other deities and great Brahmā kings, bowed their heads at my feet and praised me, saying:

source_sentence: 善哉，真是菩薩，能大利益無量眾生，欲於無明黑闇之中然大法炬。
translation: Good, it's really a bodhisattva who can greatly benefit measureless sentient beings and wants to light the great torch of the Dharma in the darkness of ignorance.

source_sentence: 由我愛惜如來大法，故相嬈惱，唯願聽我懺悔罪咎。
translation: Because we cherish the great teaching of the Tathāgata, we are both tormented and disturbed by each other. All we ask is that you allow me to confess our sins and blameworthiness.

source_sentence: 汝於未來必定成就阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，願見濟度。』
translation: You will surely attain supreme perfect enlightenment in the future, and may you be liberated.'

source_sentence: 爾時釋提桓因及諸天眾，頂禮我足，於是辭去，忽然不現。
translation: It was then that Śakra Devānām-Indra and the gods bowed their heads at my feet, departed, and suddenly disappeared.

source_sentence: 「善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 如我往昔為半偈故，捨棄此身，以是因緣，便得超越足十二劫，在彌勒前成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: Just as in the past I abandoned this body for half a verse, and because of these causes and conditions I attained unsurpassed perfect enlightenment twelve eons before Maitreya.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 我得如是無量功德，皆由供養如來正法。
translation: I've attained such measureless merit because I've made offerings to the Tathāgata's right teaching.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝今亦爾，發於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，則已超過無量無邊恒河沙等諸菩薩上。
translation: So it is with you now, who have aroused the mind of unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, and you've already surpassed measureless and limitless bodhisattvas like the sands of the Ganges River.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 是名菩薩住於大乘大般涅槃修於聖行。
translation: This is called a bodhisattva who abides in the great vehicle parinirvāṇa and cultivates noble practices.

source_sentence: ◎大般涅槃經卷第十四
